greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Least number k such that k has n anti-divisors.
comment: See A066272 for definition of anti-divisor.
link: Donovan Johnson, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..400
mathematica: antid[n_] := Select[ Union[ Join[ Select[ Divisors[2n - 1], OddQ[ # ] && # != 1 & ], Select[ Divisors[2n + 1], OddQ[ # ] && # != 1 & ], 2n/Select[ Divisors[ 2*n], OddQ[ # ] && # != 1 &]]] }, # < n & ]]; a = Table[0, {50} ]; Do[ b = Length[ antid[n]]; If[ a[[b + 1]] == 0 && b < 50, a[[b + 1]] = n], {n, 1, 2^17} ]; a
results.author: _Robert G. Wilson v_, Jan 02 2002
